query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Nel tempo che Iunone era crucciata 2 per Semelè contra ’l sangue tebano, 3 come mostrò una e altra fïata,
query.error: **English:** 1 At the time when Juno was angered 2 against Semele and the Theban blood, 3 as she showed on more than one occasion,
query.result: 1 Þa wæs Iuno swiðe yrre 2 wið Semele and ðæt Thebanisce blode, 3 swa heo æteowde gelome and gelome,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Atamante divenne tanto insano, 5 che veggendo la moglie con due figli 6 andar carcata da ciascuna mano,
query.error: **English:** 4 Athamas became so insane 5 that, seeing his wife with two children 6 walking burdened on each hand,
query.result: 4 ðæt Athamas wearð swa wod man, 5 ðæt he geseah his wif mid twam cildum 6 faran byrðene on ægðere handa,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 prendendo l’un ch’avea nome Learco, 11 e rotollo e percosselo ad un sasso; 12 e quella s’annegò con l’altro carco.

query.result: 10 and ða genam he ðone an ðe Learchus hatte, 11 and hine ymbwearp and æt anum stane 12 tobræc and ofsloh; and heo hire self adranc

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 E quando la fortuna volse in basso 14 l’altezza de’ Troian che tutto ardiva, 15 sì che ’nsieme col regno il re fu casso,

query.result: 13 And ða ða fortune wende on niðer 14 ðara Trojana ofermettost ðe eall duru, 15 swa ðæt mid rices mycle ðone cyning forleas,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 del mar si fu la dolorosa accorta, 20 forsennata latrò sì come cane; 21 tanto il dolor le fé la mente torta.
query.error: **English:** 19 the sorrowful woman became aware of her Polydorus, 20 she howled like a dog, out of her mind; 21 so much did grief twist her mind.
query.result: 19 stranða geneahhe, ða wæs seo sorhful, 20 wulfheort wægde, swa hire wæfre mod 21 for ðære earfeðnysse eall gecyrred wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.error: **English:** 22 But neither the Furies of Thebes nor the Trojan women 23 were ever seen so cruel in any battle, 24 not even tearing at animal flesh, let alone human limbs,
query.result: 22 Ac næfre on ðære Tebe ða wælhreowe 23 swa grimme ne gesawon under sunnan, 24 nænigra ðinga ðe ða deadan men,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 quant’ io vidi in due ombre smorte e nude, 26 che mordendo correvan di quel modo 27 che ’l porco quando del porcil si schiude.
query.error: **English:** 25 as I saw in two pale and naked shades, 26 who ran biting each other in the same way 27 as a pig when it bursts out of the sty.
query.result: 25 swa ic ðær geseah ða twegen sceadu 26 nacede and bleate bitre wæron, 27 and ða oðre ða ðone oðerne sloh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 L’una giunse a Capocchio, e in sul nodo 29 del collo l’assannò, sì che, tirando, 30 grattar li fece il ventre al fondo sodo.
query.error: **English:** 28 One reached Capocchio, and at the nape 29 of his neck seized him, so that, dragging him, 30 he made him scrape his belly on the hard ground.
query.result: 28 An com to Capocchie, and on ðæs swuran 29 his hneccan hine feng, swa ðæt, teonde, 30 he dyde hine gnorn his innoð on ðam heardan grunde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 E l’Aretin che rimase, tremando 32 mi disse: «Quel folletto è Gianni Schicchi, 33 e va rabbioso altrui così conciando».
query.error: **English:** 31 And the Aretine, who remained, trembling, 32 said to me: "That imp is Gianni Schicchi, 33 and he goes about thus tormenting others."
query.result: 31 And se Æretinan ðe ðær læfde, bifiende, 32 cwæð to me: "Þæt fæge deofol is Iohannes Schicchi, 33 and gæð þus wraðlice oðre swylce gedafenlice tælende."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 «Oh», diss’ io lui, «se l’altro non ti ficchi 35 li denti a dosso, non ti sia fatica 36 a dir chi è, pria che di qui si spicchi».
query.error: **English:** 34 "Oh," I said to him, "if the other one doesn't sink 35 his teeth into your back, don't let it be a bother 36 to tell me who he is, before he leaves here."
query.result: 34 "Eala," cwæð ic, "gif ðe oder ne besticeð 35 ða toðas on ðinum hrycge, ne sie ðe unnyt 36 ðæt ðu me secge, ær ðe heonon wende."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Ed elli a me: «Quell’ è l’anima antica 38 di Mirra scellerata, che divenne 39 al padre, fuor del dritto amore, amica.
query.error: **English:** 37 And he said to me: "That is the ancient soul 38 of Myrrha the wicked, who became 39 her father's mistress, outside of rightful love.
query.result: 37 And he sæde to me: "Þæt is seo ealde sawl 38 Myrrha þære yflan, seo ðe wearð 39 hyre fæder, butan rihtre lufe, leof."

query.prompt:

query.result: 40 Þeos com to syngienne wið him on ðisne wisan, 41 awendende hine sylfne on oðre hiwe, 42 swa swa ðone oðerne ðe ðær gæð, he ðolode,

43 per guadagnar la donna de la torma, 44 falsificare in sé Buoso Donati, 45 testando e dando al testamento norma».

46 E poi che i due rabbiosi fuor passati 47 sovra cu’ io avea l’occhio tenuto, 48 rivolsilo a guardar li altri mal nati.
query.error: **English:** 46 And after the two rabid ones had passed 47 over whom I had kept my eye, 48 I turned to look at the other ill-born creatures.
query.result: 46 And æfter ðæm ða ða twegen yfelan wæron forðagane, 47 ofer ða ðe ic ðone eag hæfde gehealden, 48 ða bewende ic me to ðæm oðrum yfelborenum wihtum.

query.prompt:

query.prompt:

91 E io a lui: «Chi son li due tapini 92 che fumman come man bagnate ’l verno, 93 giacendo stretti a’ tuoi destri confini?».
query.error: **English:** 91 And I to him: "Who are the two wretches 92 who smoke like men soaked through in winter, 93 lying close to your right-hand confines?".
query.result: 91 And ic to him: "Hwa sind ða twegen earmingas 92 ðe smeocan swa men deaw bedropene 93 licgende fæste be ðinum swiðran gemearce?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 «Qui li trovai—e poi volta non dierno—», 95 rispuose, «quando piovvi in questo greppo, 96 e non credo che dieno in sempiterno.

query.result: 94 "Her ic higefand—and ða forð ne wendon—", 95 andswarode, "ða ic on ðisne grund gefeoll, 96 and ic ne wene ðæt hig wendon æfre."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 L’una è la falsa ch’accusò Gioseppo; 98 l’altr’ è ’l falso Sinon greco di Troia: 99 per febbre aguta gittan tanto leppo».
query.error: **English:** 97 One is the false one who accused Joseph; 98 the other is the false Greek Sinon of Troy: 99 with sharp fever they give off such a stench.
query.result: 97 An is ðæt lease ðe Iosep wrah, 98 oðer is ðe lease Sina þe Grecisca of Troi: 99 for ðære hatan hete hi swincað swiðe.

query.prompt:

query.result: 100 And ða an ðara, ðe him ðæs to hatigean ðohte, 101 ðæt he ðus ðeostre genemned wære, 102 him ða mid ðære fyrste on ða hleore sloh.

109 Ond’ ei rispuose: «Quando tu andavi 110 al fuoco, non l’avei tu così presto; 111 ma sì e più l’avei quando coniavi».
query.error: **English:** 109 And he replied: "When you went 110 to the fire, you did not have it so quickly; 111 but you had it then and more when you were minting coins."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 E l’idropico: «Tu di’ ver di questo: 113 ma tu non fosti sì ver testimonio 114 là ’ve del ver fosti a Troia richesto».
query.error: **English:** 112 And the dropsical man: "You speak truly about this: 113 but you were not so true a witness 114 when you were asked about the truth at Troy."
query.result: 112 And se wæterseoc: "Þu segst soð ðisne: 113 ac ðu nære swa soðfæst gewita 114 ðær ðe man ðe soðe frægn æt Troia."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 «S’io dissi falso, e tu falsasti il conio», 116 disse Sinon; «e son qui per un fallo, 117 e tu per più ch’alcun altro demonio!».
query.error: **English:** 115 "If I spoke falsely, and you falsified the coin," 116 said Sinon; "and I am here for one fault, 117 and you for more than any other devil!"
query.result: 115 "Gif ic leas sprec, and ðu ðone pening logest," 116 cwæð Sinun; "and ic eom her for anum lease, 117 and ðu for maran ðonne ænig oder deofol!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 «Ricorditi, spergiuro, del cavallo», 119 rispuose quel ch’avëa infiata l’epa; 120 «e sieti reo che tutto il mondo sallo!».
query.error: **English:** 118 "Remember, perjurer, about the horse," 119 replied he who had puffed up his belly; 120 "and may you be damned so that the whole world knows it!"
query.result: 118 "Gemun ðu, forsworen, ðæs horsa," 119 andswarode se ðe ða hype habbeð, 120 "and weorð ðu awyrged ðæt eal ðeos world hit wite!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 «E te sia rea la sete onde ti crepa», 122 disse ’l Greco, «la lingua, e l’acqua marcia 123 che ’l ventre innanzi a li occhi sì t’assiepa!».
query.error: **English:** 121 "And may the thirst from which you are perishing be evil to you," 122 said the Greek, "and the tongue, and the foul water 123 that makes a hedge before your eyes in your belly!"
query.result: 121 "And mote ðæt ðurst ðe ðu ðurstest beon ðe lað," 122 cwæð se Grecisca, "and ðæt tunge, and ðæt wæter ðæt bitere 123 ðe ðinne wombe beforan ðinum eagum swa beworpen hæfð!"

query.prompt:

127 tu hai l’arsura e ’l capo che ti duole, 128 e per leccar lo specchio di Narcisso, 129 non vorresti a ’nvitar molte parole».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Ad ascoltarli er’ io del tutto fisso, 131 quando ’l maestro mi disse: «Or pur mira, 132 che per poco che teco non mi risso!».
query.error: **English:** 130 To listen to them I am now completely fixed, 131 when the master said to me: "Now just look, 132 that for a little while I do not quarrel with you!".
query.result: 130 To gehyranne heom wæs ic ða fæste, 131 ða se mæster cwæð to me: "Nu ðu scealt georne gehyrwan, 132 ðæt ðu mid me ne wære on unræde!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 133 Þa ic hine gehyrde sprecan to me mid yrre, 134 ic me gewende to him mid swylce sceome, 135 ðæt me gen ðæs gemynd on gemynde hwyrfeð.

query.prompt:

139 tal mi fec’ io, non possendo parlare, 140 che disïava scusarmi, e scusava 141 me tuttavia, e nol mi credea fare.

query.prompt:

query.result: 145 And hit is riht ðæt ic ðe sie æfre gehende, 146 gif hit eft gelimpð ðæt ðe gelede 147 ðær ðe folc sie on gelicum gefeohte:

148 ché voler ciò udire è bassa voglia».
